description.narrative: Government at national and sub-national level have strengthened capacity for evidence based policy development, multi sectoral coordination, planning, budgeting, implementation, monitoring and evaluation for nutrition., which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Supply And Logistics, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: NUTRITION Outcome: Improved coverage and increased utilization of quality and equitable nutrition services for under five children, adolescent girls and mothers in most deprived provinces and areas.

participating-org.narrative: DOPH TAKHAR DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH
FOOD AND AGRICULTURE ORGANIZATION OF THE UNITED NATIONS

sector.narrative: Data, research, evaluation, evidence generation, synthesis, and use for prevention of stunting and other forms of malnutrition
National multisectoral strategies and plans to prevent stunting (excludes intervention-specific strategies)
Technical assistance - Prevention of stunting and other forms of malnutrition

title.narrative: UNICEF Programmes in Afghanistan (Adolescent Health and Development)
Afghanistan Country Programme Document 2015-2019 Results Matrix
Afghanistan Country Programme Document 2015-2019 extended until 3/2022
UNICEF Policy on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF Procedure on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government at national and sub-national level have strengthened capacity for evidence based policy development, multi sectoral coordination, planning, budgeting, implementation, monitoring and evaluation for nutrition.

description.narrative: UNICEF has adjusted to key changes in government and with COVID context by supporting initiatives to guide services delivery adaptation in technical areas ensuring continuation of services for women and children, enhancing information and supply systems, improving the enabling environment, and generating evidence on interventions to improve service delivery quality. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/07/2020

title.narrative: Existence of a functional national multisectoral committee for nutrition
Existence of revised national nutrition policies, strategies and guidelines
Percentage of severe acute malnutrition supplies [Ready for Use Therapeutic Food (RUTF)] procured through national (on) budget
Existence of national nutrition annual report using number of evaluation and studies conducted that provide evidence in nutrition (BNA, SMART, RNA, WIFS, CBNP, IMAM)
Existence of a national management information system that includes disaggregated data on nutrition, including sex-disaggregated data
